inn1.comm: bit of outswing, full outside off, and he gets a thick edge down to third man. Looking to drive through mid-off. No real footwork
back of a length now, and it moves in and cramps Hughes for room. He gets on his toes and defends down into the pitch
bit of movement in again, from a fullish length on off stump. Hughes gets behind the line and defends with a slightly closed bat-face
short, and he's pulled that away, swivelling to dump it past the square leg boundary
that front pad moves across and nearly lands him in trouble, but the length is shortish, and he inside-edges onto his hips as he looks to tuck it away, and runs a quick single
full, just outside off, and Finch drives with a full face between the stumps and mid--on. Super shot
onto the pads, and Hughes tucks it away towards deep square leg, and calls for three as soon as he hits it
short, angling across, and he's beaten looking to pull from wide outside off stump

full, on the stumps, and there's that straight drive again, but Parnell gets down low to get his left hand to it and take some of the pace off the ball. Just missed the stumps at the bowler's end, and Hughes seemed to be out of his crease
on the pads again, and it's a full-toss as well. Hughes clips it away neatly to the square leg boundary
that's a fullish ball just outside off, and he gets a decent stride in and punches it into the covers
back of a length, a touch too straight again, and he works it off his hips square on the leg side
back of a length, angling across towards off stump, and he shuffles across to defend
a touch short, slanting across, but not a great deal of room to cut, and it bounces way more than Hughes expected and goes over his horizontal bat
a little fuller now, outside off, and he plonks that front foot across and defends towards cover point
back of a length now, and he chops it to backward point
not much width outside off, not that short, and he somehow leans away from the ball and makes enough room to steer that down to third man
raps him on the front pad as he's stuck on the crease, but that's angling down the leg side and he only lets out a muffled appeal
a little extra bounce again, perhaps, and that might have also straightened in the corridor, and it beats Hughes as he shuffles across and looks to defend off the back foot
a bit of movement from middle to off, from a fullish length, and he defends with a closed face
straightens again, and this time he just about gets his front pad out of the way and brings his bat down to defend into the off side
fullish ball outside off, and he goes hard at that drive but doesn't quite time it, and it dribbles down to mid-off
that's full, just outside off, and he slices it down to third man off the outside half of his bat
back of a length, angling across, and he gets on his toes, dabs this down into the off side and calls Hughes through for a quick single
back of a length, angling towards leg stump, and he hops and tucks that away towards deep backward square leg
back of a length again, this time on off, and he gets on his toes again to plonk that down towards square leg
back of a length again, and he's on the hop again to push it to mid-on in that typically open-chested manner
uses the angle to steer that from just outside off down to third man
nips into Finch, and pings him on the thigh pad as he looks to play into the on side. It rolls away towards midwicket, allowing them to sneak a leg bye
a touch short, and he looks to pull but gets into a very closed position. Takes his bottom-hand off, and the ball went off his bat, onto his hip, and looped up to the right of the keeper
full ball on off stump, and a bit of inswing as well. Inside edges onto the pad as he tries to push that to mid-off
short now, but there's no real width to cut, and Finch is beaten
lovely delivery, leaves Finch from back of a length and beats him outside off, opening him up completely
shortish ball, down the leg side, and Finch shuffles out of the way
onto the pads, and he works it down to wide mid-on
too full, too straight, and it's flicked handsomely off the toes to the midwicket boundary
length ball, angling towards off, and he gets a good stride in to defend back to the bowler
short, a bit of width, and he chops it straight to backward point
back of a length, angles in towards off and cramps Finch up. He jumps and bunts this down into the leg side and sends Hughes back after he rushed out of his crease
too full, on leg stump, and it's flicked away to the midwicket boundary, beautifully timed
short, and the angle takes it down the leg side as Finch jumps across his crease
short, wide, and this time Finch finds the gap to the right of de Villiers, who is stationed at a catching point
back of a length, comes in off the seam a touch, and Finch defends towards mid off
full on the pads, and Finch flicks uppishly. Loops over midwicket, but lands safely beyond anyone's reach
short, wide, and he crashes it square with a flourishing follow-through but it's too close to du Plessis at backward point
a touch short, and he pulls it between square leg and mid-on. Didn't quite time it
a touch short, not that wide, and he slaps it to cover point
that's short, wide, and he hammers that away behind point, getting down on one knee in that trademark manner, waving his bat in a circle above his head
onto the pads, and it's nudged away towards midwicket
full and wide and Hughes comes forward and swings his bat through a full, circular arc to crash that to the point boundary
drifts onto the pads and gets away as Finch falls over and can't connect with the flick. Struck on the front pad but clearly slanting down the leg side
back of a length in the corridor, and that bounces steeply and straightens just a touch to beat Finch's prod
on the pads again, and it's clipped away to deep backward square leg
full on the pads, and he squirts it down to square leg
that's full outside off, and he's hit on the front pad as he drives down the wrong line, but he has thrust it well across, outside the line
a little fuller now on off, and he drives it into the covers
angles this across on a good length, and Hughes gets across, and defends awkwardly into his front pad
back of a length now, and Hughes dabs it towards point with an open face
down the pitch now, and he sees him coming and bowls the slower ball. Adjusts and steers this towards point
that's full, angled across, and he drives to the left of cover with a lot of bottom hand
back of a length now, and he jumps across the crease and dabs it down towards square leg
back of a length on the pads, and he tucks it away towards midwicket
length ball outside off, and he pokes it towards cover point with an open face
slants this towards middle and leg, and he pushes it towards mid-on, shuffling across the crease
that's short outside off, and he's beaten by steepling bounce as he looks to pull
onto the pads again, and it's tucked away into the vacant square leg region. Oh, he didn't get bat on that. Straight off the thigh pad, and the wicketkeeper had to run all the way to stop that
again slants down leg, and once again it's off the thigh pad as he looks to tuck it off his hips
back of a length outside off, and Hughes lets it go
back of a length, and he gets on his toes and tucks it away towards midwicket
that's full on off stump, and he drives it between the bowler and mid-off, lots of bottom hand to hit that with a closed face and place it where he wanted
length ball, angled across outside off, and he gets a big stride out to defend towards cover
short, and he doesn't quite control that pull from outside off, but it drops down well short of the deep backward square leg fielder
back of a length outside off, and it stops on Finch a little. Looks initially to punch through cover, pushes it to mid-off instead
that's full, and he plays that lovely straight drive again but Parnell dives to his left from mid-on to stop the ball
starts the over with a bouncer, and it goes so far over a ducking Hughes that the umpire signals wide
onto the pads now, and he rolls his wrists over to work that down to deep backward square leg
short and wide, and he slaps it to deep cover point
disconcerting lift from Morkel, and it hits Hughes on the glove as he looks to defend off the back foot
onto the pads, and it's tucked neatly down to fine leg
that's full on off and middle, and he pushes that wide of midwicket, closing his bat face at the last moment, and immediately calls for two
short and wide outside off, and he shaped to cut but decided against it when he saw how much it bounced
slants across, back of a length, and gives him just enough width - he doesn't need much, does he? - to carve that away backward of point for four
back of a length, angling across, and he hops and uses his hands beautifully to clip that softly towards square leg
full, wide, and he drives it to the right of deep cover
that's full, slower ball, angling in towards middle, and he defends down the pitch
length ball angling towards off, and he comes forward and pushes it towards cover point. Du Plessis makes good ground from backward point to cut off the single
that slower offcutter again, on middle and off. Thought about clipping it through midwicket and decided in the end to defend with a full face towards cover

that's quite full on off, and he goes on the back foot to push that into the covers. Shades of the footwork Aravinda de Silva used to play an insane square cut against Shane Warne in the 1996 World Cup final, but none of the execution, since this was a much more conservative shot
full, angling across towards off, defended back to the bowler
tossed up now, and he drives it down to long-on
looks to slog-sweep from just outside off, and doesn't get hold of it, sends it rolling down towards deep square leg
angles this across, and it might have been the googly. Hughes is alert and defends with a straight bat towards mid-off
full again, on the stumps, and he defends back to the bowler
back of a length, just outside off, and he hops to defend into the off side
back of a length, angling towards off, and he plays it with the angle to short midwicket
short ball, and he thinks of pulling but sees the bounce and drops his bat at the last moment
slower ball outside off, and he stays in the crease, stays leg side of the ball, and slaps it towards point
onto the pads, and he flicks a little uppishly but it falls safely short of short midwicket
that's full, just outside off, and he looks to drive through cover and ends up inside-edging it down towards square leg
too short, pitching middle and finishing just outside off, Finch stays back and hits it towards long on
Hughes gets down on one knee to sweep one that is pitching outside leg, can't beat the fielder at short fine eg
an appeal for lbw after Hughes tries to sweep again but misses, that looked like it pitched outside leg but replays indicate it pitched in line, close call
driven firmly to point
short ball and Hughes rocks back to pull it to deep square leg, he brings up his half century off 56 balls
cut off the back foot to deep point
a full toss from round the wicket, a bit of drift across the right-hander, Finch drives to long on
nudged off the front foot towards point
played off the front foot to midwicket
Hughes comes forward and plays a swatty drive to cover, not timed well
once again the timing is awry after he gets on to the front foot and pushes on the off side
stayed in his crease this time and dug a full ball out and placed it into the gap at cover
bowled full outside off from over the wicket, Hughes square drives to point

caught at cover! Hughes' timing has been off against the slow bowlers and he's gone and hit one straight to AB at cover. He came out of his crease to play the big drive over the infield, he didn't get to the pitch of the ball and the timing was poor
gets going right away with a punch down the ground
that's the quicker ball, Finch was on the back foot and was hit on the pad, that was sliding down leg though
played back to the bowler, there's a definite change in tempo since the spinners came on
the googly but it's too short, allowing Finch the space to go back and cut past backward point, the fielder from short third man gives chase
a bit too full, Finch gets on the front foot and drives straight past the bowler
bowled full from round the wicket, Marsh stays in his crease and plays on the leg side
he aims for long-on but Duminy moves to his right to cut off the shot
defended back to the bowler
driven back to the bowler once again
the offbreak slants across the right-hander from cover the wicket and spins in a touch, Marsh goes back and punches to cover
good length and straight, Finch stays back and defends on the leg side
stays back to another good length ball on off and middle and nudges towards midwicket
banged in short this time, Finch tries to pull but his balance is not right, the timing is poor but he manages to play it down by rolling wrists, the ball goes towards fine leg
stays in his crease to another good length ball and closes the face to play the ball towards square leg
defended on the back foot towards cover
stays back and steers to third man
pitches middle but the length is too short and allows the batsmen to go back and punch the ball to long on
Finch gets on the front foot and defends towards point, a fuller length from Tahir
good length outside off, Finch stays back and drives in front of point for a single
Marsh leans forward and pushes the ball towards long on again
too full to stay back to, Finch had to defend that awkwardly back to the bowler
slightly overpitched and Finch drives to long off for one more
Finch gets hit on the thigh by a short of a length delivery that angles into him, Steyn runs across to prevent a leg bye
stays in his crease once again and turns the ball off his pad to midwicket, Finch is not moving forward against Steyn
short ball and this time Finch controls the pull well, swivels and rolls wrists to keep it along the ground to fine leg
Marsh works the shorter ball off his hips behind square for a single

short of a length outside off, Finch stays back and swats the ball down through cover, the timing is not the best but that means Amla has to cover a lot more ground from the deep to reach the ball, there's time for a hard-run two
tapped towards cover point for a single
that's too short and there's room outside off to work with too, an easy delivery for Finch to late cut past short third man to bring up his half-century
short again and outside off, Finch cuts again but this time he can't beat Morkel at short third man
played with soft hands into the covers for a single
defended on the off side, Tahir's length was great that time, spin and bounce

Tahir appealed and then began celebrating a moment before the umpire raised the finger, because that was as plumb as it gets. Marsh was caught on the back foot by a quicker and straighter ball that skidded on and hit the pad before he could get his bat across.
tossed up nicely on off stump, Bailey drives on the front foot, Tahir dives to his left to cut it off

edged just wide of the diving Quinton de Kock! Finch stayed in his crease and poked at a good length ball that angled into him from outside off. The ball seemed to travel slowly and de Kock dived, but could not dive far enough

a huge appeal for caught behind, after Finch gets beaten on the inside edge this time. Morkel jagged the ball back into the right-hander and cut Finch in half. That ball brushed his shirt on its way through to de Kock
Morkel oversteps this time, the batsman nudges towards midwicket for a single. Free-hit coming up.
short of a length Bailey swats it away through square leg, not much return from the free hit
defended on the back foot towards the off side
a fuller length and Finch is not really forward, seemed to be on the move as he hit that towards extra cover
top delivery to end a top over, Morkel bangs in the bouncer and is too quick for Finch, who is late on the pull shot
a lovely delivery from Tahir, flight, dip, turn and bounce from a off stump line. Bailey came forward to defend but was beaten by the flight and the ball spun past his outside edge
defended towards cover
defended on the off side, towards cover
played from the crease towards point
a bit too straight this time, nudged off the pads behind square
defended on the front foot
gets hit on the pad by a good length ball that angled into him, Finch was off balance again as he tried to come forward to that
Finch moves half forward and pushes the ball through midwicket, AB hares after the ball and dives to keep the batsmen to one
the short ball is down leg side this time, Finch pulls and helps it down to the fine leg boundary
short of a length angling into the body, Finch stands tall and drops it close on the leg side and runs
good length outside off stump, Bailey shoulders arms
a full ball on the pads, flicked from the crease through square leg
Bailey did not pick the googly, tried to cut it off the back foot and was beaten
tossed up on middle and off, driven back to the bowler
a firm drive, but can't beat cover
that's the bit short but it is also quicker and straighter, cramps Bailey for room on the back foot, he defends to the bowler

whoa! They have taken on AB and survived! Bailey dropped the ball close towards cover and ran. Finch responded without hesitation but he would have been gone had AB hit at the striker's end. He came sprinting in, picking up and under-armed it at the stumps, so close
cut off the back foot to backward point
good length and straight, Bailey gets behind the line and blocks
good length just outside off stump, defended from the crease on the off side
short of a length and Bailey drags that from outside off stump through square leg
a length ball on off and middle, Finch taps it close on the leg side and runs
short of a length, Bailey swivels and pulls, crisply hit along the ground to deep square leg, he needs a few more to hit the middle of his bat
Finch bottom edges a length delivery near his feet
Bailey wanted to drive that over cover, instead he got a thick inside edge that went through midwicket. That was the googly. Amla fumbled in the deep to allow the extra run
that's what he wanted to do the previous delivery! This ball is fuller and there's width outside off, Bailey gets to the pitch of it and lofts over extra cover
swept behind square for a single
Finch hits the ball down the ground for a single
defended on the front foot on the off side
steps out to take the ball on the full and clips it through square leg
a full ball on the pads, flicked to fine leg for a single
strays on to the pads again, this one goes off the thigh pad to the fine leg boundary, fine leg is in the circle so that's a poor line
played from the crease towards short cover
good length and straight, defended back to the bowler
a full toss that Bailey works off the pads through square leg
short of a length outside off, cut off the back foot to third man
good length on middle and leg, tried to work it towards square and missed
Bailey steers the length ball to third man for a single
a short ball outside off, Finch tries to pull it but mis-times it on the off side

Finch's edged it again but this time it's well wide of the keeper but fine enough to beat third man, he stayed back in his crease and pushed hard at a short of a length delivery that got a bit high on him
played through midwicket for one more
that's too full and too wide, Bailey has time to free his arms and loft the ball down to the long off boundary
Finch stays back to a good length ball and drops it close on the off side for a single
fuller and straighter, Bailey jumps back and across to work the ball through midwicket
a full toss down leg side, Steyn's lucky Finch did not connect with his glance
good length outside off stump, Finch defends from his crease towards point, rarely does he get on the front foot
Finch has a waft at one that pitches on a good length and moves slightly away from the right-hander, good bounce and carry through to de Kock
again the ball bounces a bit more from a good length, the line is just outside off, Finch pokes and misses
short and wide outside off, Finch stays back like he usually does and cuts, beats the fielder at backward point, beats third man too
back of a length around off, Bailey goes back and taps it towards midwicket
Finch does the same thing, goes back and pushes a length ball on the on side for a single
the slower one outside off, Bailey has a swing at it but mis-times the shot, he manages to clear the infield at cover though
another slower ball, a shorter one, it sits up outside off and Bailey pulls through midwicket
slapped off the back foot towards cover point, where Parnell dives to his right to save four runs, there was no one in the deep
another slower short ball, Bailey swivels and pulls along the ground for a single
Bailey drives a length ball to long off for a single
Finch gets hit on the thigh as he tries to work a short of a length ball towards square leg
a full ball on the pads, Bailey flicks in front of square for a single
short of a length from over the wicket, Finch plays a short-arm jab to hit the ball behind square
poor line, outside leg stump, poor length, too short. All Bailey has to do is move across and nudge the ball past the keeper, and he does it well
first six of the innings! Bailey lines up a length delivery and clobbers it flat over the long-on boundary, mid-on was in the circle so there was no real danger in that shot. Superbly executed.
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away to midwicket
looked to slog this over wide long on, but he didn't quite get hold of it and pulled it around squarer than he wanted, and it goes all along the ground to the left of the deep midwicket fielder
tossed up outside off, and it gives Finch enough room to free his arms and launch that over Miller, running desperately to his left from long-on
sweeps this from middle and leg to the short fine leg fielder
down the pitch now, and he whips it away to deep midwicket
full and straight, and he nudges it away to square leg
starts with a short ball down the leg side, and Finch shuffles across to allow that through to the keeper
short and wide, and he slaps it to deep cover
back of a length, nice and close to off stump, and he opens his bat face and dabs the ball towards point
back of a length again, and he punches it to mid-off off the back foot. That stopped on him slightly
short ball, and he pulls it round to deep square leg
on the pads now, and he nurdles it away to the left of deep square leg
short again, and this time he pulls it to the right of deep midwicket
length ball just outside leg, and he paddles it to the right of short fine leg
on middle stump now, and he sweeps down to deep square leg
there's that sweep again, and this time he's hit it hard enough to beat the deep square leg running to his right
full ball on middle and leg, and Finch can push it down to long-on to jog to the other end and bring up his fourth ODI century. Very well played, he's paced his innings perfectly
down the pitch now, and he's flicked it between deep square leg and deep midwicket, and the placement allows them to run two
tosses it up outside off now, and he looks for a single after dabbing to point, but decides against it
back of a length, and he hops and punches this to short cover
back of a length again, and this time he plays a touch later and punches it to the left of short cover and out to the sweeper at deep cover point
looks for the full, straight ball, and gets it all wrong, and slants it down the leg side
full, on the pads, and he's clipped it away to deep backward square leg

full, and he plays that favourite straight drive of his, forcing AB to dive full-length to his left to stop that at mid-on. Bailey was a little dozy and he threw to the keeper's end, but he was safely home
and now Bailey brings up his fifty with a lovely lofted drive over extra cover, as Morkel bowls him a length ball with just enough width to free his arms
short now, and once again he slants it down the leg side
that's full, and he drives elegantly to the right of Steyn, who falls to his right, gets a hand to it, but can't quite make the stop
short and wide, but it's the offcutter, and it comes in a touch and sneaks under Finch's bat, dying on its way through to the keeper
and he's gone. That was short outside off, and he couldn't quite control the pull from above shoulder height, and deep square leg comes in a few yards and takes the simplest of catches
back of a length, angling into the stumps, and he tucks it away to the left of deep midwicket
short and wide and he has to reach for the ball to cut it to the right of third man
back of a length, angling into the body, and he's hit on the thigh as he looks to tuck it through square leg. Rolls down towards short midwicket
short and wide, and Maxwell is beaten by bounce as he looks to slap it with an angled bat
back of a length, angling in and straightens towards off and middle. Jumps in the air to defend back to the bowler
looks to flick that from the stumps, and ends up skying it over the leg side. Two fielders chase, but it drops between AB running to his right from mid on and McLaren to his left from deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, defended back to the bowler off the back foot
short ball, and how well has he timed that? It was angling down leg, and he used the angle and swivelled to help that over the deep backward square leg boundary
length ball angling in towards off stump. Bailey knocks it to point, thinks of a single, and decides against it

what did he do there? Bailey was opened up by this back of a length ball that straightened just outside off, and it may have bounced more than expected, and, oh my, the ball's missed his outside edge completely and hit his trouser pocket on its way through to the keeper. The umpire's finger went up immediately
short ball, angling down the leg, and he's got enough bat on it to send it down to the fine leg boundary, very fine
fuller now, on off stump, and he punches it down to mid-off
short again, just outside off, and he pulls it hard to deep square leg
length ball outside off, and Smith leaves it through to the keeper
short ball, and he looks to pull and inside-edges it into his body
length ball on off stump, and he drives it crisply to deep cover
full, and slants it down the leg side again. It hasn't been Morkel's best day in terms of accuracy
back of a length, comes in from outside off, and he gets on top of the bounce and steers it deftly to the left of third man
back of a length, and it straightens from outside off. Maxwell, pushing at it with half a bat, is beaten
that's full, and he whips it wristily from off stump to short midwicket
short, down the leg side, and de Kock lets out a wistful caught behind appeal. Maxwell looked to pull and got nowhere near the ball
down the track, doesn't get to the pitch, and he's slogged that straight up in the air. AB de Villiers takes a simple catch, running a few yards to his left from mid-on
back of a length outside off, and he uses the angle to bunt it down into the on side and take a quick run
short ball, angling down the leg side again, he gets a bit of hip on that and it dies just short of de Kock scrambling to his left
full on leg stump, and short midwicket dives to his left to cut off that flick
there's the slog-sweep, and he catches that in the middle of his bat and it soars over midwicket and clears the ropes quite comfortably
shortish, and it hurries on, but quick feet help him get back and cut that in front of square
down the pitch, and he bowls the googly that turns and bounces from outside off. Smith prods forward to defend, and it goes off his pad into the leg side
short, and he's back in a flash to pull to the left of deep midwicket
beautifully bowled. He went back to cut, and the googly turned sharply and rapped him on the pad. The inside-edge saves him
that was full outside off, and he works it through AB, who misfields - shock, horror! - at short midwicket

they had a slip in, and the ball has flown into his hands at chest height. Excellent captaincy from AB, excellent ball from Steyn. It was full outside off, but not quite driving length. Haddin went hard at it with no footwork, and Amla pouches the thick outside edge
short ball, rising towards the rib-cage. He gets nicely behind it and defends down the pitch
length ball on middle stump, which he pushes down to the right of the bowler. AB is very wide at mid-on, but he makes a lot of ground to his left to cut off the single
length ball just outside off, and he pokes it down towards point and they run the quick one this time
back of a length outside off, and he opens his bat face and steers it down to third man
full-toss on middle and leg, flicked away to deep midwicket
another full-toss, on off stump this time, and he pushes it down to long-on
down the pitch and converts this into a third full-toss in a row. Cover dives to his right to stop the drive
length ball, slides on towards off stump, and he comes forward and defends into the off side
full on leg stump, and du Plessis dives left at short midwicket to cut that off
goes back in his crease now, and works this off the stumps towards deep midwicket
back of a length, angling in towards middle and off, and he has no room to do anything but block it back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, bunted away towards backward point with soft hands
sees Faulkner backing away, and bowls a fast, short ball just outside off that climbs steeply into de Kock's gloves. Faulkner could do nothing but let it go

that's a length ball outside off, and he looks to slash it over cover and gets a thick outside edge that bounces down to the left of third man. Excellent fielding by Tahir to palm that away from the rope
best shot in the book, the thick outside edge that beats the diving keeper. It was full, just outside off, and he gave room and went hard at it, looking towards extra cover
makes room again, and this time he bowls the slower one outside off. Slaps it to du Plessis backward point and runs the single. Direct hit at the bowler's end would have been interesting
sees him backing away outside leg, and bowls the slower ball on middle and leg. Once again, a thick outside edge down to third man. Was looking to slash it through cover point, perhaps
gives himself room again and McLaren follows him with the bouncer, but it bounces way over the head and well down the leg side, and the umpire has to give that wide
down the pitch, and converts this into a wide full-toss that he slaps away past cover point diving to his left
slower ball, and it's another full-toss, and he only has to open his bat face to send that screaming high past backward point
another slower ball, and again Smith has loads of room outside off. Slashes hard, over the infield,  and finds that backward point boundary again
now he moves across to the off side and whips this full ball to deep midwicket
backs away again, looks to go over extra cover, and he bowled it straight this time. Smith misses, McLaren hits. I think that was poor execution more than anything else, it was there to be hit
short ball, gets to Faulkner too quickly to pull, and he ends up hitting it much straighter than he wanted, down to long-on
short ball, rising towards the ribcage, and he bunts it down towards deep backward square leg
that's the wide yorker, and it sneaks under Faulkner's bat as he backs away and tries to crash that through point
that's full outside off, and he drags it round to wide long-on. Hit that very low on the bat
short, and he gives himself room and slices that high off the outside half of his bat, bounces down towards third man
back of a length, angling across, and he gets on his toes to push that towards mid-off
short ball, and Mitch has clubbed that from just outside off over the midwicket boundary. Sound baseball technique, lovely swivel of the hips
full on leg stump, and it goes off his pad backward of square as he looks to flick
back of a length, follows Faulkner as he gives himself room. Squirts it down towards cover point
that's the old length ball on off stump, and Mitch clears his front leg and swings his arms through it to launch that over deep square leg and into the crowd
this time he makes room and hits it over extra cover. Was a pretty good ball, very full, and he dIdn't quite time it, and it slows down as it approaches the boundary
full again, but Mitchell's cleared his front leg and made enough swinging room to drive that hard, down the ground, all along the ground, between the stumps and long-on

inn2.comm: that's full on off stump and de Kock pushes it back to Johnson, who sticks out his left arm to field that in his follow-through
back of a length now, and he works it off the stumps backward of square leg
back of a length, a bit of swing in and it hits Amla on the thigh pad as he looks to work it through the leg side
back of a length again, outside off this time, and he defends solidly to mid-off
short now, but there isn't enough width for him to cut that with any power
angled across, back of a length, and he shuffles across to defend into the off side
back of a length, and just enough width for him to punch that away between cover and mid-off. Beautifully timed
a bit of outswing from a nice full length, and he doesn't really move his feet but strokes that sweetly to cover
a bit of extra bounce as he slants this leg-side. Looks to work it towards midwicket, and it hits high on the bat and drops down close to the batsman
this one's too full, and he flicks it from middle and off into the vacant midwicket area
down the leg side now, and de Kock can't quite get any bat on it as he looks to tickle it fine
length ball on off, and he drives that between the stumps and mid-on. Didn't time it as well as he would have liked
ohoho! That was a length ball outside off, and he frees those arms and smacks that to the left of cover
full on off stump, and he looks to drive but it dribbles down the ground off the bottom of his bat
short, wide, and it's cracked away hard to the left of backward point and the right of third man
this one isn't as wide, and he goes for that cut again and inside-edges it past the stumps towards short fine leg
bit of inswing down the leg side, and he's struck on the pad as he looks to work it leg side.
back of a length now, and he gets off his feet and uses his wrists to play that towards square leg
short, down the leg side, and he helps that away very fine. Richardson sprints to his right and puts in the dive to stop it just short of the rope
length ball, angling in towards off, stroked to mid-off
what a shot that is. That's a length ball just outside off, and he comes forward and punches that with a straight bat, on the up to the left of mid-off

was that a drop? It's back of a length now, and he looks to steer it to third man, and ends up outside-edging it to the right of Haddin. He dived, and it just fell short of his glove and ran down to the boundary
back of a length again, and this time he punches it to cover
back of a length again, defended with soft hands into the off side
very consistent line and length this, and Amla waved his bat at it with no footwork, and he's beaten by a bit of extra bounce
short ball, and he plays a good-looking pull down to deep backward square leg
short, and he looks to pull from outside off, and is beaten, the ball going under his bat
again he's beaten on the pull, but this time it bounces well over his bat. Johnson properly dug this in, straighter line as well, not far from Amla's head
length ball on off, and he stays on the back foot and punches it between the stumps and mid-off. That's all eye and hands, and no feet whatsoever
that's very full, outside off, and he brings his bat down to dig that out towards cover
that's short and down the leg side, and Amla moves his feet for once to shuffle across and let that pass through to the keeper
throws his hands at this ball slanting across him from back of a length, and misses completely
back of a length, angling across, and he punches it into the covers
a bit of width, and he comes forward to drive on the up through point. Maxwell chases back from cover
back of a length, and it's worked away wristily through midwicket
onto the pads now, and it's clipped away to the left of deep backward square leg
length ball on the stumps, and he pushes firmly back to the bowler, who sticks out his left hand and deflects it towards mid-on
back of a length, angling towards off, and he defends back to the bowler
full, angling across, and Amla is beaten trying to lash that through square cover. Went too hard at it
back of a length, comes in a touch, and he jumps across to defend. It bounces back off the pitch and runs away behind square and they steal a quick run
back of a length outside off, and he opens his bat face and steers it down to third man
full on the pads, and he flicks it to midwicket. Again he seemed to snatch a little hard at it, which is strange for a batsman who normally caresses everything
short, just a bit of width, and he cuts it hard into the ground. Bounces over Smith, who jumps and lifts his arms over his head to stop that
that's a yorker on middle and off, and he brings his bat down quickly to block that into the covers
moves away off the pitch from just back of a length, outside off. Amla follows the angle with his bat, and the ball beats his outside edge

and he's gone! Short, wide, and he slaps that straight into the hands of the point fielder, who dived forward to take that low down. Super catch from Smith, who already saved a boundary earlier in the over. They're checking if it's a clean catch, and while the replays aren't very good in terms of picture quality, there's nothing on them to suggest it was remotely in doubt. They're taking very long to decide, however... and finally he raises his finger after getting the go-ahead over the walkie-talkie
length ball, angles in and straightens outside off, and it bounced a little extra too. Du Plessis' bottom hand comes off as he defended, and it hit him high on the bat, on the sticker
length ball outside off, and du Plessis lets it go
wider still, and it seemed to be juust inside the tram-line as du Plessis left it, but the umpire's given it wide. Fair enough, because it's only a guide
full, on the stumps, and he didn't quite time that drive, which runs away to the left of mid-off
length ball outside off, lots of bounce, and Faf leaves again
back of a length on off, and he opens his bat face and steers it down to third man
back of a length outside off, and he plays it with the angle to dab it to point
length ball angling across, and Faf leaves it outside off
full, and he leans on it to drive it to the right of cover and the left of mid-off
length ball on off, and he waves his bat at the ball, without too much footwork, to push that to mid-off on the up
but they had a deep square leg as well, and he bangs it in short. De Kock didn't get hold of the pull, and the top-edge drops into that man's hands as he runs in a few yards from the rope
and he starts with a lovely punch through point as Richardson gives him some width
extra bounce from a fullish length, and he comes forward before leaning back to adjust and slap that to point
length ball, driven on the up to short cover
that's full, angling in towards off, and he defends to short midwicket with a straight bat
that's full and wide, and he jams that into the ground as he reaches across and tries to slap it through point
back of a length, angling towards top of off, and he defends carefully off the back foot
length ball angling towards off, and he defends with a straight bat to mid-off
looks to slap that through cover but it's too full for that, and he hits it to mid-off instead
back of a length on off stump, and that's a super punch through extra cover. Slows down short of the rope though, and mid-off can chase and pull that back
short ball, and that simply takes off. AB lets it go, and Haddin has to jump a couple of feet to catch that with his right glove
again that lifts steeply, and AB has to withdraw from his stroke after shaping to cut
this one's just wide enough, and even though it bounced steeply he was able to cut that over point and down to the boundary
another bouncer, and AB goes back and across and leans out of the way to let it go
nice length ball to start with, straightens from middle and off, and he's opened up a touch but manages to play that down to mid-off off the outside half of his bat
back of a length now, punched to cover
a little shorter, outside off, and Faf is beaten by extra bounce as he throws his bat at it
back of a length, angling towards off, and he makes some room but his punch goes straight to backward point
short, and this sits up for du Plessis to pull witheringly over midwicket, with a full extension of the arms
back of a length, a bit of width, and short cover does well to anticipate and move to his left to stop that powerful punch
full on off stump, and he defends back to the bowler. Took a huge back and across step, outside off, and moved back to an orthodox position to defend that
again that massive back and across step, and he bunts this down to deep backward square as Johnson tucks him up with a back-of-a-length ball
short, angling away, and bounces and leaves him outside off and he stops himself after initially looking to pull
length ball, angling towards off, and he stays leg side of the ball and pushes it out to cover
length ball on middle and off, and he drives this to mid-on
back of a length, and it's steered off the back foot to deep point
down the pitch, and he bangs this short outside off, and he plays a tennis smash down the ground, between the stumps and the non-striker. What a shot!
length ball, defended back to the bowler off the back foot
down the pitch again, makes a bit of room, and pushes it with a straight bat to the left of mid-off
shortish ball, looked like the offcutter, and he waited for it to come into him and dabbed it down to third man
full, angled down the leg side, and Haddin moves quickly to his left to stop the batsmen from sneaking a leg bye
that's full on middle stump, and he got his front leg out of the way and pushed this to mid-on
short, not short enough to pull too powerfully, but he manages to hit that from hip-height down to deep square leg
that's full on middle stump, and he gets that front foot out of the way and drives it to the right of mid-off
back of a length, angling across, and he lets it go, after taking that big step across with his back foot
full, and he shows him the full face and drives that handsomely between the bowler and mid-on

I think he's going deep in his crease to give himself a little more time. This is very full, and he's deep inside his crease as he drives that to the right of cover, who does well to dive and stop that
short ball, angling across, and AB leans away and lets it go
length ball just outside off, driven on the up to short cover
back of a length, a bit of width, and he's dabbed it away neatly to the right of third man
length ball on the stumps, and he plays a wristy drive to mid-on
length ball on middle, and he dabs it away with the angle to the left of short cover
down the pitch, and he shortens his length a touch in response, and he defends it towards short midwicket
length ball, and he might be a little put off by AB's initial movement, whangs this down the leg side
length ball, angling across, and he defends into the off side
a length ball on middle and leg, deftly turned off the pads towards fine leg
short of a length, pulled along the ground to long leg
nudged off the hips once again behind square, Marsh has been a bit too straight this over
Du Plessis charges Marsh, picks up a length ball and hits through the line on the up, lofting it over mid-on for four
steps out again and flicks a full and straight ball over midwicket
AB flicks one off is pads through square, plenty of leg-side runs this over
short of a length around middle and off from Faulkner, AB stays in his crease and punches to mid-off
banged in short from over the wicket, angling across the right-hander, AB pulls flat over the infield
that's not that short but Faf plays an awesome shot, going back in a flash and pulling with extremely quick hands, places it in front of the fielder on the midwicket boundary
stays back to a good length ball and is hit on the thigh as he tries to nudge on the leg side
defended from the crease towards point
Faf steps out again and slugs a length ball straight past the bowler, Faulkner tries to get hand on it but fails
a length ball, driven on the up through cover point
a fuller ball, Faf drives with a super straight bat, places it to mid-off
Faf's getting a move on! He drags a short one from wide outside off and smacks it wide of the fielder on the midwicket boundary
short on the hips, pulled through square leg for a single this time
stays in his crease and steers to third man for one more
a fuller ball on middle and leg, driven to mid-on
that is a horrific ball, the shortest long hop you could hope to get, AB goes back and picks his spot on the midwicket boundary and pulls the ball towards it
cut off the back foot through point
good ball, beat Faf in the flight as he came out of the crease, he had to defend to the bowler
goes back this time and punches it back to the bowler
stays back to a good length ball and drives through cover
the fielder at short cover dives to his right to take some pace off a fierce drive, the deflection takes the ball towards long off
gets behind the line of a good length ball and defends with a straight bat
short ball and AB swats it through square with a short-arm pull
short of a length outside off, Faf waits on it and dabs towards third man
AB steps out of his crease but Faulkner fires the ball down leg-side, he'll have to re-bowl that
a full ball on the pads, AB flicks through square
goes round the wicket and delivers a low full toss, he was looking for the blockhole, Faf drives but can't beat cover
defended from the crease towards midwicket, length was good and the line did not give the batsman much room
a flighted delivery on a good length just outside off, AB waits for it on the front foot and square drives through point
driven through mid off for another single

he's teed off and it's a tremendous blow! Smith gave the ball air, AB waited for it, wound up and then swung hard with a full, free swing of the bat, the ball disappeared into the stands behind the bowler's head
driven to cover, he hit that firmly too
short with width, AB goes back and slaps the ball hard, hitting it flat over cover and into the gap on the boundary. Smith's spell is going poorly for Australia
a full ball outside off, he waits in his crease and square drives for one more
good length and straight, AB gets behind the line and blocks with a straight bat
goes wide of the crease from round the wicket and angles the ball into the right-hander, AB opens the face and plays the ball towards point
steps out and drives the ball to long on for one more
a full ball on the pads, AB moves inside the line and glances to long leg

no dot ball there, Faf pushes to mid off and sprints, it's a risky single to bring up his half-century. Some Australians have hands on their heads. Might have been close had there been a hit at the bowler's end. Faf's fast, though
pulled through square leg for one more
AB works the ball off his pads through square leg
Faf has enough time to go back and work the ball off his pads through square leg
pitches outside leg, AB tries to glance but misses, he gets hit on the pad, Faf says no to the leg bye
played through midwicket for a single
played off the pads through square leg again, Maxwell is pitching them all outside leg
driven to long off for another single
pushed off the front foot through covers for a single
played to midwicket off the front foot
a full one outside off, slanting across the batsman, who mis-times the shot towards cover but still manages to find the gap
jumps out of his crease to make room and nearly yorks himself, ends up squeezing the ball out on the off side
pulled flat, pulled in the air, and pulled short of the fielder at deep square leg, the 100 partnership is up and it looks dangerous for Australia
defended with a straight bat towards the bowler
nudged to midwicket for a single
pushed gently on the leg side for one more
goes back into his crease and drives the ball to long on
tossed up on off and middle stump, driven to long off for the fourth single of the over
nudged off the pads to square leg, the fielder is in close
gets down on one knee pretty early and paddle scoops the ball towards fine leg
defended back to the bowler
short of a length on the hips, played off the back foot through square
a length ball angling across the right-hander, driven on the up through cover point
good length and straight, defended on the leg side
a well directed bouncer, AB keeps his eyes on it and sways out of the way
AB uses the width outside off stump to steer to third man and bring up his 50 off 49 balls
AB gets down on one knee and reverse sweeps through point
goes right back to a straight delivery from round the wicket and whips it off his pads through square
Faf moves across, gets down low, and paddles the ball fine
worked off the pads towards square leg where a fumble from the fielder allows the single
driven firmly into the covers where a half-stop can't prevent the single
full and straight, driven to long on for one more
short of a length angling into the batsman, played from the crease to point
Faf gives Starc the charge, makes a bit of room by moving outside leg to free his arms and loft over cover, no protection in that area in the deep
in the blockhole, a fine comeback from the bowler, but Faf is good enough to jam his bat down and play the ball towards third man
AB lets the short ball come at him and then he leans back and rides the bounce, tapping the ball down towards third man
that's too short, and it did not get high enough to trouble Faf, who swivelled and pulled the ball flat towards the midwicket boundary
played behind square and the ball is timed slow enough for the batsmen to hare back for the second
AB stays in his crease and pulls a length ball in front of square leg
a short ball and it's pulled away to the fielder at deep midwicket
steps out and pulls the ball to deep midwicket
Faf steps out and slogs across the line, gets an inside edge on to his pad
the length is not that short but AB is able to bring his bat down in a flash and cut swiftly through point
worked off the pads through square leg
AB square drives a length ball through point for a single
good length and straight, played back to the bowler with a straight bat
Faf tries to turn a straight ball (pitched outside leg) on the leg side but misses and is hit on the pad, Johnson picks up in his follow through and hits the stumps at the striker's end
that is some shot! The ball was fast and nearly in the blockhole, Faf stayed in his crease and scooped it out, and timed it well enough to beat the fielder at mid off
full once again outside off, driven to mid off for one more

is that six? I think the ball landed full on the boundary rope which means it is a six. It's a close one, did it hit the ground before hitting the rope? Nope, it's a six. Faf had got on the front foot and launched a length ball on the up over mid-off with a crisp punch
AB charges a short ball and pulls, he gets beaten on the bottom edge
a length ball outside off, square driven through point for a single
worked off the pads towards fine leg, they sprint back for the second, there's some excitement as the stumps are broken at the keeper's end, AB was safe
good length on off and middle, pushed past the bowler for a single, and AB seems to be struggling with his left leg, he is clutching his hamstring, might be cramp
flicked off the hips through square leg
defended back to the bowler
length ball, and he comes forward and pushes it to long-off and trots to the other end
short, wide, and cut away past backward point, who dived in vain to his right
back of a length, closer to off now, and he chops that forward of point. Didn't really come on to the bat
back of a length, and he works this from off stump past midwicket
full-toss wide outside off, and he reaches out and pushes that to deep cover
back of a length, steered down to third man with an open face
length ball on off stump, and that's caressed on the up, no need to move his feet, to the left of a sprawling mid-off
back of a length outside off, and he dabs this to backward point
on the pads this time, and it's tucked away to deep backward square leg
length ball angling in towards off, and he plays that with soft hands to dab it towards point. Loud call of "no!" from the non-striker
short, a bit of width, but it kept a little low and he can only chop it downwards towards cover point, without any power behind it
short, wide, and it's slapped away to deep cover
he's dropped a dolly! AB shuffled across, and he bowled the slower ball. He popped it straight back at Mitch, slowly, loopily, at waist height, and he only had to cup his hands, and he floored it.
another chance, tough one this time, not really a chance. Half-hearted slash outside off, and it bounces and takes his outside edge and screams past a diving Haddin
fuller now, closer to off, and he pushes it into the covers
full, angled across wide of off. Tries to steer this into the covers, doesn't quite time it, and it bounces quite close to him and comes to a halt
that's full, on off stump, and he drives it to long-off
slower ball, full outside off, and he sort of pokes at it without really wanting to, and it misses his edge through to the keeper
full on off, and he drives it to the right of the sweeper at deep cover
full now, and he pushes it back to the bowler
another drop! And it's Bailey, of all people. It was slapped hard to him at point, but it went straight at him, at midriff-height, and it's in and out, after a little juggle
length ball, angling in towards off, and he chops it to short third man. May have been looking to play that a bit finer and find the gap
length ball again, angling towards off, no real room, and he dabs it to point and calls AB through for a single
and now it's on the stumps, length ball, and he gives himself room and cracks that over mid-off. Grabbed his hamstring after playing the shot
full on middle stump, and he gets his front foot out of the way and drives it down to long-off
back of a length on off, and he makes a bit of room and slaps that to deep cover
back of a length outside off, doesn't quite come on. He waits on it and punches it to short cover
full now, and he drives straight to short cover
back of a length now, and he waits for it to come on and dabs it with soft hands to soft cover, permitting an easy single

and here's an AB special. His hamstring is in pieces, but he walks across the crease, gets down on one knee, and scoops this full-toss over the fine leg boundary. He's holding his thigh again. Loads of pain, loads of gain
that's full and wide, and he cracks that to the cover boundary and off goes the helmet, after he leaps and punches the air. First ODI century for du Plessis, and what an innings this has been
full again, closer to off this time, and he drives this down to long-off
that's full again, and AB makes a little bit of room and lifts that with a straight bat over mid-off. What a shot, what an innings, what a player!
full-toss now, and he pushes it down to long-on
whoa! That's a stunner! It's full on middle, and he punches that hard down the ground, over the umpire's head, and both long-on and long-off are very straight but neither of them moved

and the bouncer gets him, finally. It rose up well over shoulder height, and he decided to take it on, and Smith, the fielder at midwicket, ran back towards the boundary and took an excellent catch as it dropped over his shoulder
that's full on off and middle, and he tucks it away towards deep midwicket
length ball, angling across, and he's deep in his crease to steer that to the sweeper at deep cover. He runs two, grimacing all the way
short, wide, and he makes a bit more room to carve that into the massive gap between deep cover and long-off
back of a length now, on off stump, and he pushes it out to deep cover

they're checking for that bit of fielding at the deep point boundary. Maxwell pulls it back, but his foot seems to hit the boundary triangle just as he does so. Benefit of doubt given to the fielder. Gave Duminy a bit of width, and he steered that off the back foot
back of a length, and AB works that deep cover fielder again, pushing it out to him for a single
onto the pads, and he nurdles that away to the right of midwicket
looks to cut that, but it isn't short enough or wide enough for that. Sneaks under his bat
looks for the yorker, and a big appeal after he's struck on the front pad, but there was a big inside edge on that as he tried to push that down to long-on
another yorker, tails in late, and he digs it out to short cover. Looked like a catch at first, before I realised he'd hit that into the ground
short ball, gets up over head height but slowly, and he waits on it and smacks that down towards midwicket, hitting over the top of the ball
and he runs another two. Wow. That's full on off and middle, and he flicks it away to deep square leg
back of a length on off, and he goes back and across and pushes that to point
that's in the blockhole but a touch leg-stumpish, and he clips it away off his toes to deep midwicket
that's full, angling across, and he gets behind it and defends carefully into the off side
that's full, on the pads, and he whips it to the left of deep square leg
short, and he manages to control that pull pretty well down to deep square leg, from about head-height
full on off, and he drives it to cover
slants it onto the pads, and he clips it away to the left of deep square leg. Difficult two, and he somehow sprints through and even puts in the dive
slower bouncer outside off, and it loops way over head height before dropping into Haddin's gloves
back of a length, angling in towards leg and middle, and he makes room to punch it to deep cover
angles it in, back of a length, and gets it to straighten past the outside edge as he pushes forward to defend
and he does it again! This time, he was looking to open his face and dab it behind point
onto the pads, and he clips it away to deep midwicket
short, doesn't quite come on to the bat, and he mistimes the pull down to short midwicket
short, wide, and he's carved it away backward of point. Mitch Marsh tumbles to his left to stop that after running round from third man
onto the pads now, and he clips it down to deep backward square leg
short, wide, and it didn't quite come on. Chopped away to deep cover
that's full, tailing in towards off, and he pushes that down to mid-on with a straight bat
looks for the yorker, and slants this down the leg side
full and wide, and he steers that to the left of point with an open face, and they run three, despite AB's twingy hammy
full on off, and he's waiting for precisely that ball after that big step back in his crease. Lifts that over mid-off, doesn't quite time it, and Starc can chase back and pull it back with the slide
Chops this short ball to backward point and goes for the run. Has to dive to complete it as the throw comes in, and misses the stumps
back of a length, angling in towards off, and he plays a late dab down to third man
short, angling in, and he backs away and slaps it to deep cover
oho! What a shot that is! A step out of his crease, and it's a length ball, on off stump, which he hammers back over the umpire's head for six
back of a length now, dabbed down to third man
full and wide, and he flat-bats that to the right of deep cover
angles this down leg, and he nurdles it down to fine leg

That was a one-handed slap over short fine leg. He walked across the stumps, fell over, and hit it with only his bottom hand over the fielder. Didn't quite time it, but how do you time a shot like that?
back of a length, just outside off, dabbed down to third man
now he drives it down to long-off and walks the single. "More of this!" his hamstring must be telling him.
short ball, lots of bounce, and he decides against pulling it, swaying away instead
short, and this time it's only shoulder-high, at a gentle pace off the pitch, and he controls the pull down to deep backward square leg
short, and it's pulled away to the left of the deep backward square leg fielder
short again, and he works this off his hips towards square leg
length ball on off, and he's in the perfect position, having given himself a little bit of room, to launch that over mid-off
now he backs away from the stumps and slaps this wide-ish yorker to deep cover, falling over a touch as he does so
short ball, and he pulls it round to deep backward square leg
full-toss on the pads, and he tucks it away to the right of deep midwicket
full on off stump, and he plays a controlled drive out to the deep cover sweeper
back of a length, rising towards the rib-cage, and he manages to ride the bounce and drop the ball down into the off side. He's nursing his fingers, so I guess it's hit him on the glove
short ball, and again it bounces over head high as Duminy lets it go
full on middle stump, and he clips it away into the gap between midwicket and mid-on. That races away to the boundary, super timing
now he bowls this down the leg side, and Duminy, shuffling across, can't quite get his bat on that flick
it's a slower ball on middle stump, and a quick single down to mid-on does it for South Africa. What a chase this has been!
